column4: BRIEF- Tesla CEO Musk says model 3 could generate $20 bln in revenue per year
column5: * Ceo musk says new products in strategic plan could cost "tens of billions" over time

column4: Fiat Chrysler revamps U.S. sales reporting amid federal probes
column5: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles   said on Tuesday it had revised more than five years of monthly U.S. vehicle sales figures to reflect a new reporting method  amid an investigation by federal authorities into claims of inflated sales figures.

column4: UPDATE 3-Fiat Chrysler revamps U.S. sales reporting amid federal probes
column5: July 26 Fiat Chrysler Automobiles   said on Tuesday it had revised more than five years of monthly U.S. vehicle sales figures to reflect a new reporting method  amid an investigation by federal authorities into claims of inflated sales figures.

column4: U.S. report says Tesla in fatal Autopilot crash was speeding
column5: WASHINGTON A driver killed in the May 7 crash of a Tesla Motors Inc  car while using Autopilot driving-assist software was exceeding the speed limit  U.S. highway safety investigators said on Tuesday in a preliminary report that did not state a probable cause.

column4: UPDATE 2-U.S. report says Tesla in fatal Autopilot crash was speeding
column5: WASHINGTON  July 26 A driver killed in the May 7 crash of a Tesla Motors Inc car while using Autopilot driving-assist software was exceeding the speed limit  U.S. highway safety investigators said on Tuesday in a preliminary report that did not state a probable cause.

column4: Mobileye split with Tesla spurs debate on self-driving tech
column5: BENGALURU/DETROIT A rift between Tesla Motors Inc  and key supplier Mobileye NV  sent down shares of the Israeli maker of chips for the electric vehicle maker's semi-automated Autopilot system and fanned debate on self-driving vehicle technology.

column4: UPDATE 4-Mobileye split with Tesla spurs debate on self-driving tech
column5: BENGALURU/DETROIT  July 26 A rift between Tesla Motors Inc and key supplier Mobileye NV sent down shares of the Israeli maker of chips for the electric vehicle maker's semi-automated Autopilot system and fanned debate on self-driving vehicle technology.

column4: Mobileye shares sink on news Tesla contract won't be extended
column5: July 26 Shares of Mobileye NV  an Israeli maker of driving-assistance chips and software  plummeted on Tuesday after the company said its contract with Tesla Motors Inc would not be renewed after its expiry.
